Juego de kgada se cae en cada actualizaciÃ³n y ni una pc arriba de los requisitos recomendados lo corre bien porque se laguea con todo.

Although to post a review of the game I have to say I'd recommend the game or not, personally I wouldn't recommend nor would I advice against this game and here is why. The game in itself is amazing. The style, the characters, perspectives and so many more elements to this game make it one of the best and most addictive I've ever played.
The community however can be trash. You get some cool people who win or loss know how to be sportsmen like. But most will team up on comms, down rank and bully other players and troll. Not to mention those who abuse bugs in the game, hack, ect. "What online game doesn't have that kind of community?" <- this question is exactly why i make my first sentence the way i did.
Basically, it's a fun game. If you can put up with the bull, take it as a challenge to get better, and maybe put some toxic trash in their place, have at it. I know that's what my aim is.
Its good to play with friends and play as killer. Great way to meet new people and get competitive. Looking past the hiccups and it turns out to be pretty good

Very addictive, very high skill ceiling on both sides. Newest killers have all been extremely fun to play, developers have been keeping major updates on a tight schedule.

Balance is probably the best it's ever been - definitely worth a look.

There's a lot of toxic and whiny players alike in the player base. As for the game though? They release buggy messes like the ptb doesn't exist to point out the bugs. Behavior doesn't listen either, when confronted with criticism they have on the record said to "play a different game".
good game however, The devs keep ruining the game with every update for killer. Killer gets nerfed every update and get worse and worse ever so slowly which sucks for us who only really play killer.

Two thousand hours in, 100% completion (until the next patch) I can say without a shadow of a doubt that this is still my favorite game. something draws me back time after time. despite moments of rage and laughter something about Dbd maintains it's grip on me. 

Keep strong everyone, Good luck out there.

This game is like playing hide-and-seek. Only online. With total randos. And you're either playing a hideous murderer or a victim running for your life. Other than that, though, it's exactly the same.

As for the actual gameplay, in every round you can either play as one of four victims trying to escape the playing area (third-person play) or as the killer (first-person play), whose role is pretty self-explanatory. With all of the DLCs, there are a lot of familiar faces among the victims and the killers, like Laurie Strode or Freddie Krueger, and plenty of different locations. You can join up with your friends, or you can be cast into the void with a group of (usually cool) strangers. There are a few douchecanoes in the mix, but when isn't there?

With every round and every act in those rounds, you collect "bloodpoints," which enable you to raise your characters' levels and get them perks that may or may not help. There are also micro-transactions in the form of "auric cells," and those are mostly required to unlock cooler badges, different outfits or weapons, and a pittance of further auric cells. An annoyance? Yes. A reason not to play the game? Definitely not.

That's about it. The graphics are solid, the music is decent, and the locations (for the most part) are randomly assigned, making each round different from the last. One little tip for n00bs: don't hang someone on a hook and then set up camp in the area so you can pick the other players off when they come and try to rescue their fellow victims. It's cheap, and lazy, and just about all the seasoned players hate it.

Other than that, go forth and enjoy!
Playing as the killer is fun, and when you have a party to work together a survivors, it's super fun. One of my favorite games!
Ruined my life and relations with friends <3 Much better than dota 2
